sen.j: 京都学生祭典（きょうとがくせいさいてん）とは、毎年10月上旬に（過去に一部例外あり）日本の京都市で開催されている祭。
sen.e: Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa is an annual festival which is held in early October of the year (not always for the past) in Kyoto, Japan.
sen.cmt: 全般的なコメント：”企画”という用語がしばしば出てきますが、当祭典を意味する場合と、実施されるプログラムを指す場合とがあるようです。どちらを指すのか明確でない場合がありました。
sen.e: Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa is an annual festival which is held every year in early October (though not always in the past) in Kyoto, Japan.
Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa is an annual festival which is held every year in early October (though not always in the past) in Kyoto, Japan.

sen.j: 京都市が策定した大学のまち・京都21プランがイベントコンセプトの基本となっている。
sen.e: A basic concept for the event is Daigaku no Machi, Kyoto 21 Plan (City for Universities, Kyoto 21 Plan) which was established by Kyoto City.
The idea for the event is based on Kyoto City's "Daigaku no Machi (City of Universties), Kyoto 21 Plan."
The idea for the event is based on Kyoto City's "Daigaku no Machi (City of Universties), Kyoto 21 Plan."

sen.j: 2000～2002年に大学コンソーシアム京都が主催して実施された京都・学生フェスティバルが発展して、京都学生祭典となった。
sen.e: Students Festival in Kyoto was held from 2000 through 2002 under the auspices of The Consortium of Universities in Kyoto, and then developed into the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.
From 2000 through 2002, the Student Festival in Kyoto was held under the auspices of The Consortium of Universities in Kyoto, later developing into the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.
From 2000 through 2002, the Student Festival in Kyoto was held under the auspices of The Consortium of Universities in Kyoto, later developing into the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.

sen.j: 直近の第5回は、2007年10月6日・7日に開催され、2日間合計で観客動員数21万5,500人を記録し、過去最高となった（主催者発表）。
sen.e: Most recently, the 5th Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa was held on October 6 and 7, 2007 and marked a record high of 215,500 visitors for the two days (according to the organizer's announcement.)
The 5th and most recent Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa was held on October 6 and 7, 2007 and marked a record high of 215,500 visitors for the two days (according to the organizer's).
The fifth and most recent Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa was held on October 6 and 7, 2007 and marked a record high of 215,500 visitors for the two days (according to the organizer's).

sen.j: 第3回京都学生祭典から創作オリジナルおどり「京炎 そでふれ!」が導入された。
sen.e: Commencing with the 3rd Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, an original dance 'Kyoen Sodefure! (literally, waving sleeves in hot Kyoto)' was introduced.
Commencing with the 3rd Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, an original dance, 'Kyoen Sodefure! (literally, waving sleeves in hot Kyoto),' was introduced.
Commencing with the third Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, an original dance, 'Kyoen Sodefure! (literally, waving sleeves in hot Kyoto),' was introduced.

sen.j: 第4回京都学生祭典から本祭2日間開催となった。
sen.e: Since the 4th Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, it has been held for two days.
Since the 4th Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, it has been held over two days.
Since the fourth Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, it has been held over two days.

sen.j: 第5回京都学生祭典では創作みこし「京炎みこし」が制作された。
sen.e: For the 5th Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, an original mikoshi (portable shrine) was constructed.
For the 5th Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, an original mikoshi (portable shrine) was constructed.
For the fifth Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, an original mikoshi (portable shrine) was constructed.

sen.j: 京都学生祭典実行委員会（主催団体）
sen.e: Execution Committee of Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa (organizer)
Executive Committee of the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa (organizer)
Executive Committee of the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa (organizer)

sen.j: 有志の学生によって構成されている。
sen.e: The committee is composed by the students interested.
The committee is composed of student volunteers.
The committee is composed of student volunteers.

sen.j: （財団法人大学コンソーシアム京都の加盟大学に所属している必要はないが、実行委員に応募する資格に「大学・大学院・短期大学・専修学校に通う18歳以上の学生であること」という規定があるため、高校生以下は所属することができない。※過去に例外あり）
sen.e: (Members of the Execution Committee do not have to be a formal student in a member university of the Consortium of Universities in Kyoto Foundation, but there is a provision that 'students who are 18 or older and belong to either of university, graduate school, two-year college and special course school are eligible to apply for the Execution Committee members' and students of less 18 are not allowed to join the committee. There was an exception in the past.)

(Members of the Executive Committee do not have to be formal students in a member university of the Consortium of Universities in Kyoto Foundation, but there is a provision that 'students who are 18 or older and belong to a university, graduate school, two-year college and special course school are eligible to apply for Executive Committee membership', while students under 18 are not allowed to join the committee. There was an exception in the past.)

(Members of the Executive Committee do not have to be formal students in a member university of the Consortium of Universities in Kyoto Foundation, but there is a provision that 'students who are 18 or older and belong to a university, graduate school, two-year college and special course school are eligible to apply for Executive Committee membership', while students under 18 are not allowed to join the committee. There was an exception in the past.)

sen.j: 実行委員長・副実行委員長の下に、以下の各部が置かれている。
sen.e: The following departments and functions are established below Execution Chairperson and Vice-chairperson:
The following departments and functions are established under the Executive Chairperson and Vice-Chairperson.
The following departments and functions are established under the Executive Chairperson and Vice-Chairperson.
(As of October 2007)
(As of October 2007)
(As of October 2007)

sen.j: 企画運営部 - 京都学生祭典にて実施する企画の立案・運営を担当
sen.e: The Planning and Management Department is in charge of the planning and management of the programs to be implemented for the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.
The Planning and Management Department is in charge of the planning and management of programs to be implemented during the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.
The Planning and Management Department is in charge of the planning and management of programs to be implemented during the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.

sen.j: 営業部 - 協賛金等、開催資金集めを担当
sen.e: The Marketing Department is in charge of financing the Festa through the collection of funds from sponsors, etc.
The Marketing Department is in charge of financing the Festa through the collection of funds from sponsors, etc.
The Marketing Department is in charge of financing the Festa through the collection of funds from sponsors, etc.

sen.j: 広報部 - 京都学生祭典の広報・宣伝を担当
sen.e: The Public Relations Department is in charge of the advertisement and public notice of the Festa.
The Public Relations Department is in charge of advertising and publicity for the Festa.
The Public Relations Department is in charge of advertising and publicity for the Festa.

sen.j: おどり普及部 - 創作おどり京炎 そでふれ！の普及活動を担当
sen.e: The Odori Fukyu (dance popularizing) Department is in charge of wide spreading an original dance Kyoen Sodefure!.
The Odori Fukyu (dance popularizing) Department is in charge of popularizing the 'Kyoen Sodefure!' original dance.
The Odori Fukyu (dance popularizing) Department is in charge of popularizing the 'Kyoen Sodefure!' original dance.

sen.j: 警備部 - 京都学生祭典当日の警備計画立案・実行を担当
sen.e: The Security Department is in charge of the preparation and execution of the security plan for the day of the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.
The Security Department is in charge of planning and implementing security on the day of the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.
The Security Department is in charge of planning and implementing security on the day of the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.

sen.j: 総務部 - 財務・庶務等、実行委員会活動に付随するその他の活動を担当
sen.e: The General Affairs Department is in charge of any other activities associated with the Execution Committee's activities including financing and office work.
The General Affairs Department is in charge of any other activities associated with the Executive Committee's activities, including financing and office work.
The General Affairs Department is in charge of any other activities associated with the Executive Committee's activities, including financing and office work.

sen.j: 上記部署以外にも臨時のプロジェクトチームが結成されることがある（例：みこしプロジェクト など）。
sen.e: In addition to the above departments, special project teams can be formed (e.g. Mikoshi Project.)
In addition to the above departments, there are also special project teams (e.g. Mikoshi Project).
In addition to the above departments, there are also special project teams (e.g. Mikoshi Project).

sen.j: また、京都学生祭典は産・学・公・地域連携で開催されるため、以下のような協議会が設けられている。
sen.e: Since the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa is held in collaboration of businesses, academia, public sectors and local communities, the following cooperative bodies are organized.
Since the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa is held in collaboration with businesses, academia, the public sector and local communities, the following cooperative bodies are organized.
Since the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa is held in collaboration with businesses, academia, the public sector and local communities, the following cooperative bodies are organized.

sen.j: 京都学生祭典組織委員会（共催団体）
sen.e: Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Organizing Committee (co-host)
Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Organizing Committee (co-host)
Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Organizing Committee (co-host)

sen.j: 大学・経済界・行政の長、計12名（以下に記載）によって構成されており、京都学生祭典事業に対する最終的な議決・承認機関となっている。
sen.e: The Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Organizing Committee consists of the twelve individuals who are the heads of university, business and government sectors (as stated below) and works to make a final resolution or approval for the Kyoto Intercollegiate Fest related matters.

The Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Organizing Committee consists of twelve individuals who are the heads of universities, business and government sectors (as stated below) and works to make a final resolution or approval for the Kyoto Intercollegiate Fest related matters.

The Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Organizing Committee consists of 12 individuals who are the heads of universities, business and government sectors (as stated below) and works to make a final resolution or approval for the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa related matters.

sen.j: 京都府知事
sen.e: Kyoto Governor
Governor of Kyoto
sen.cmt: OK but changed word order for consistency with others
sen.e: Governor of Kyoto

sen.j: 京都市長
sen.e: Mayor of Kyoto City
Mayor of Kyoto City
Mayor of Kyoto City

sen.j: 京都商工会議所 会頭
sen.e: Chairman of Kyoto Chamber of Commerce and Industry
Chairman of the Kyoto Chamber of Commerce and Industry
Chairman of the Kyoto Chamber of Commerce and Industry

sen.j: 社団法人京都経済同友会 代表幹事
sen.e: Chairman of Kyoto Association of Corporate Executives
Chairman of the Kyoto Association of Corporate Executives
Chairman of the Kyoto Association of Corporate Executives

sen.j: 京都学生祭典企画検討委員会 代表
sen.e: Chairman of the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Planning & Consideration Committee
Chairman of the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Planning & Research Committee
Chairman of the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Planning & Research Committee

sen.j: 財団法人大学コンソーシアム京都 理事長
sen.e: Director of the Consortium of Universities in Kyoto
Director of the Consortium of Universities in Kyoto
Director of the Consortium of Universities in Kyoto

sen.j: 財団法人大学コンソーシアム京都 副理事長（3名）
sen.e: Vice-directors (three) of the Consortium of Universities in Kyoto Execution Committee
Vice-directors (three) of the Consortium of Universities in Kyoto
Vice-directors (three) of the Consortium of Universities in Kyoto

sen.j: 京都学生祭典実行委員会 実行委員長
sen.e: Execution Chairman of the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Execution Committee
Executive Chairman of the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Executive Committee
Executive Chairman of the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Executive Committee

sen.j: 京都学生祭典実行委員会 副実行委員長（2名）
sen.e: Vice-execution Chairmen (two) of the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Execution Committee
Vice-Executive Chairmen (two) of the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Executive Committee
Vice-Executive Chairmen (two) of the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Executive Committee

sen.j: 京都学生祭典企画検討委員会
sen.e: Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Planning & Consideration Committee
Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Planning & Research Committee
Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Planning & Research Committee

sen.j: 財団法人大学コンソーシアム京都加盟大学の学生部長クラス、協賛企業の担当者、行政・地域の担当者などによって構成されている。
sen.e: The committee consists of dean-level personnel of member universities of the Consortium of Universities in Kyoto Foundation and personnel of sponsor companies and public and local community sectors.

The organizing committee consists of dean-level personnel of member universities of the Consortium of Universities in Kyoto Foundation and personnel of sponsor companies and public and local community sectors.
sen.cmt: Added "organizing" to avoid confusion with any of the above committees
sen.e: The organizing committee consists of dean-level personnel of member universities of the Consortium of Universities in Kyoto Foundation and personnel of sponsor companies and public and local community sectors.

sen.j: 主な企画
sen.e: Major programs
Major programs
Major programs

sen.j: 京炎 そでふれ！全国おどりコンテスト
sen.e: "Kyoen Sodefure!"National Dancing Competition
"Kyoen Sodefure!" National Dancing Competition
"Kyoen Sodefure!" National Dancing Competition

sen.j: 第3回京都学生祭典より開始され、以後毎年実施されている。
sen.e: The competition has been annually held since the 3rd Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.
The competition has been annually held since the 3rd Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.
The competition has been annually held since the third Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.

sen.j: 4つの部門（小学生以下の部、中・高校生の部、大学生の部、一般の部）に分かれて行われる、ノンジャンルの踊りコンテスト。
sen.e: It is an uncategorized dance competition with the four sections (elementary school & younger children, middle & high school students, university students, and the other.)
It is an uncategorized dance competition with four sections (elementary school & younger children, middle & high school students, university students, and general).
It is an uncategorized dance competition with four sections (elementary school & younger children, middle & high school students, university students, and general).

sen.j: 表彰は基本的に部門ごとに行われるが、例外的に各部門横断の「京炎 そでふれ！賞」などの特別賞も設定されている。
sen.e: Winners are basically decided by each section, but exceptionally, 'Kyoen Sodefure! Award' and other special prizes are given to winners selected throughout the four sections.
Winners are basically decided for each section, but there are also special prizes, such as the 'Kyoen Sodefure! Award', which are given to winners selected across the four sections.
Winners are basically decided for each section, but there are also special prizes, such as the 'Kyoen Sodefure! Award', which are given to winners selected across the four sections.

sen.j: この企画が創設された背景に、京炎 そでふれ！の普及のためという目的があり、コンテストに参加した団体は後述するGrand Finaleの総おどりに原則参加という規定がある（高校生以下は時間帯の問題もあり、参加を強制していない）。
sen.e: One of the reasons for holding this contest seems to make the Kyoen Sodefure! widespread, and there is a provision that groups which have participated in this program in principle have to join So Odori (a dance festival) for the Grand Finale which will be explained below (High school and younger students are not forced to join the So Odori due to the late time.)

One of the reasons for holding this contest is to make the Kyoen Sodefure! well-known, and there is a rule that, in principle, groups which have participated in the competition have to join the So Odori (a dance festival) for the Grand Finale, which will be explained below (high school and younger students are not forced to join the So Odori due to the late time.)

One of the reasons for holding this contest is to make the Kyoen Sodefure! well-known, and there is a rule that, in principle, groups which have participated in the competition have to join the So Odori (a dance festival) for the Grand Finale, which will be explained below (high school and younger students are not forced to join the So Odori due to the late time.)

sen.j: また、特別賞となっている「京炎 そでふれ！賞」は、チームの半数以上のメンバーが四竹を持っていることを審査する対象としている。
sen.e: To be qualified for 'Kyoen Sodefure! Award" as a special prize, half or more members of the group need to be playing with the Yotsutake instrument (a set of clappers made of bamboo) for the competition.
To qualify for the "Kyoen Sodefure! Award", at least half the members of the group need to be playing the Yotsutake (a set of clappers made of bamboo).
To qualify for the 'Kyoen Sodefure! Award', at least half the members of the group need to be playing the Yotsutake (a set of clappers made of bamboo).

sen.j: 第1回京都学生祭典より毎回実施されている。
sen.e: It has been annually held since the 1st Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.
It has been held annually since the 1st Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.
It has been held annually since the first Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.
sen.cmt: 「Kyoto Student Music Award」という見出しがオリジナルにはあります。話がつながらないので調べてみてわかりました。1st→first

sen.j: 優勝者には賞金の他にGIZA studioよりメジャーデビューへのバックアップが受けられるという学生音楽コンテスト。
sen.e: Winners of the Student Music Contest can get prize money and also backup support from GIZA studio in making a major debut.
Winners of the Student Music Contest can get prize money and also backup support from GIZA studio in making a major debut.
Winners of the Student Music Contest can get prize money and also backup support from GIZA studio in making a major debut.

sen.j: 学生音楽コンテストであるため、ソロであれば当人が学生、グループであれば構成するメンバーの半数以上が学生である必要がある。
sen.e: Due to the nature of this contest, if a participant does a solo, he or she has to be a student, and in case of a group of musicians, half or more members of the group have to be students.
Due to the nature of the contest, if a participant does a solo, he or she has to be a student, and for groups of musicians, at least half the members have to be students.
Due to the nature of the contest, if a participant does a solo, he or she has to be a student, and for groups of musicians, at least half the members have to be students.

sen.j: 審査は、デモテープによる1次審査で20組に絞り、その20組による二次予選を公開ライヴ形式にて行い、本選に出場する10組を選出する。
sen.e: In the 1st judgment, twenty participants are chosen based on the provided demonstration tapes, and in the 2nd judgment, ten participants are chosen based on a public live contest to challenge the final contest.

In the 1st round of judging, twenty participants are chosen based on the provided demo tapes, and in the 2nd round, ten participants are chosen for the final on the basis of a live public performance.

In the first round of judging, 20 participants are chosen based on the provided demo tapes, and in the second round, 10 participants are chosen for the final on the basis of a live public performance.

sen.j: 京都学生祭典本祭当日（※過去に例外あり）に、本選出場10組による公開ライヴ審査が行われ、グランプリほか各賞が即日決定する。
sen.e: On the day of Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, ten final participants compete to play performance for a public live contest and winners for grandprix and other awards are determined on the same day.
On the day of Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, the ten finalists perform live and the winners of the Grand Prix and other awards are determined on the same day.
On the day of Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, the 10 finalists perform live and the winners of the Grand Prix and other awards are determined on the same day.

sen.j: 縁日
sen.e: Ennichi (Hopping)
Fair
sen.cmt: Not sure why this was translated as it was, when there is a good enough equivalent, although my dictionary gives "hopping" as Tyneside dialect for 'fair'
sen.e: Fair

sen.j: 第3回京都学生祭典（縁日＠京都学生祭典という企画名で開催）より開始され、以後毎年実施されている。
sen.e: The ennichi (hopping) has been annually held since the 3rd Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa (under the program name "Ennichi @ Kyoto Intercollegiate Fest".)
There has been a fair (or 'ennichi') held annually since the 3rd Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa (under the program name "Ennichi @ Kyoto Intercollegiate Fest").
There has been a fair (or 'ennichi') held annually since the third Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa (under the program name "Ennichi @ Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa").

sen.j: ただ第1回京都学生祭典においても、企画名称こそ異なれど、ほぼ同様の企画が実施されていたため、実質毎年開催されているといえる（※第2回京都学生祭典は除く）。
sen.e: But, the very similar program was held for the 1st Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa under the different name, so it can be said that it was actually held very year (*except for the 2nd Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.)

However a very similar event was held during the 1st Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa under a different name, so it could be said that it has actually been held very year (*except for the 2nd Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.)

However a very similar event was held during the first Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa under a different name, so it could be said that it has in fact been held every year (except for the second Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.)
sen.cmt: very year→every year序数スペルアウト "actually" -> "in fact" に変更しました。

sen.j: 特定のステージなどで行われる企画と違い、各大学サークルや大学祭実行委員会、地元自治体、などが出店する店舗を総称して縁日と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Unlike projects performed on a special stage, shops or sales places operated by university student groups, university festival executive committee and local public sectors are collectively called ennichi.
Unlike projects performed on a special stage, the stalls of the 'ennichi' are run by individual university clubs, university festival executive committees and local authorities.
Unlike projects performed on a special stage, the stalls of the 'ennichi' are run by individual university clubs, university festival executive committees and local authorities.

sen.j: 第2回京都学生祭典～冬の陣～にて、食中毒事件が発生した教訓から、食物を扱う同企画では食中毒対策に特に力が入れられるようになった。
sen.e: In the 2nd Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa - Winter Battle -, a food poisoning incident occurred, and based on the lesson from the incident, the prevention of food poisoning has been more focused because the ennichi is involved in serving foods.
Following a case of food poisoning during the 2nd Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa - Winter Battle -, there has been more focus on preventing food poisoning during the 'ennichi'.
Following a case of food poisoning during the socond Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa - Winter Battle -, there has been more focus on preventing food poisoning during the 'ennichi'.

sen.j: また第5回京都学生祭典からはエコ・プロジェクトの一環としてリユース食器が取り入れられた。
sen.e: Since the 5th Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, recycling or reusable plates and utensils have been introduced for a part of the ecological project.
sen.cmt: 学生祭典とエコプロジェクトとの関係が定かでありません。
sen.e: Since the 5th Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, reusable plates and utensils have been introduced as part of an ecological project.
Since the fifth Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, reusable plates and utensils have been introduced as part of an ecological project.

sen.j: 企業連携シリーズ
sen.e: Business collaboration series
Business collaboration series
Business collaboration series

sen.j: 第4回京都学生祭典より開始、第5回京都学生祭典でも継続で実施された。
sen.e: Collaborating with businesses was first introduced in the 4th Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, and again in the 5th Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.
Collaborating with businesses was first introduced in the 4th Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, and again in the 5th Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.
Collaborating with businesses was first introduced in the fourth Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, and again in the fifth Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.

sen.j: 学生と企業のコラボレーションで企画を実施するというのがコンセプトで、第4回京都学生祭典では株式会社わかさ生活と連携し、企業連携シリーズ 京都学生祭典&わかさ生活 げんきっずスタジアムという企画名で実施された。
sen.e: In the 4th Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa with the concept that students and businesses should cooperate in performing programs, a program titled "Business Collaboration Series: Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa & Wakasa Seikatsu Gen-kids Stadium" was launched in cooperation with Wakasa Seikatsu Corporation.

Based on the concept that students and businesses should cooperate in performing programs, a program titled "Business Collaboration Series: Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa & Wakasa Seikatsu Gen-kids Stadium" was launched in cooperation with Wakasa Seikatsu Corporation at the 4th Kyoto Intercollegiate Fest.

Based on the concept that students and businesses should cooperate in performing programs, a program titled "Business Collaboration Series: Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa and Wakasa Seikatsu Gen-kids Stadium" was launched in cooperation with Wakasa Seikatsu Corporation at the fourth Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.

sen.j: また第5回京都学生祭典では、株式会社わかさ生活との連携継続の他に、佐川急便株式会社と連携し、企業連携シリーズ 京都学生祭典 & 佐川急便 Sports Live!～あなたへ届け感動便～という企画名で実施された。
sen.e: In the 5th Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, a program titled "Business Collaboration Series: Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa & Sagawa Express Sports Live! - Anata ni Todoke Kandobin (sending the excitement of the sports to you) -" was launched in cooperation with Sagawa Express Co., Ltd. and Wakasa Seikatsu Corporation.

For the 5th Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, a program titled "Business Collaboration Series: Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa & Sagawa Express Sports Live! - Anata ni Todoke Kandobin (Delivering the Excitement to You) -" was launched in cooperation with Sagawa Express Co., Ltd. and Wakasa Seikatsu Corporation.

For the fifth Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, a program titled "Business Collaboration Series: Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa and Sagawa Express Sports Live! - Anata ni Todoke Kandobin (Delivering the Excitement to You) -" was launched in cooperation with Sagawa Express Co., Ltd. and Wakasa Seikatsu Corporation.

sen.j: 京都学生祭典の最後を飾る企画で、第1回京都学生祭典より毎回実施されている。
sen.e: The program is the last event for the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa and expected to bring about a more exciting finale, and has been held every year since the 1st Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.
This is the climax of the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa and has been held every year since the 1st Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.
This is the climax of the Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa and has been held every year since the first Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.
sen.cmt: 「Grand Finale」という見出しがオリジナルにはあります。序数スペルアウト

sen.j: 第3回京都学生祭典以降は平安神宮境内の特別ステージで開催されるようになり、京炎 そでふれ！全国おどりコンテストの受賞者による演舞や、Kyoto Student Music Awardのグランプリ受賞者ライヴなどを中心にプログラムが組まれており、最後には来場者全員による京炎 そでふれ！総おどりで幕を閉じるのが毎年恒例となっている。
sen.e: Since the 3rd Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, the festa has been performed on a special stage in Heian Jingu shrine and the dance performance of winners in "Kyoen Sodefure!"National Dancing Competition and the live performance of grandprix honorees from the Kyoto Student Music Award have been a highlight for the program every year with the finale of the whole audience participating in "Kyoen Sodefure! So Odori".

Since the 3rd Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, it has been performed on a special stage in Heian-Jingu Shrine, with highlights including performances by the winners of the "Kyoen Sodefure!" National Dancing Competition and the Grand Prix winners of the Kyoto Student Music Award, and closes with the whole audience participating in the "Kyoen Sodefure! So Odori".

Since the third Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, it has been performed on a special stage in Heian-Jingu Shrine, with highlights including performances by the winners of the "Kyoen Sodefure!" National Dancing Competition and the Grand Prix winners of the Kyoto Student Music Award, and closes with the whole audience participating in the "Kyoen Sodefure! So Odori".

tit.j: 京炎 そでふれ！について

sen.j: 第3回京都学生祭典のコンセプト「イベントからまつりへ」のもと、まつりを象徴するおどりの導入が検討されるようになり、京都学生祭典実行委員会と京都学生祭典事務局、有識者などで構成されるプロジェクトチームが発足した。
sen.e: The 3rd Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa was planned with a concept 'From Event To Festival', and since then, the consideration of introducing a dance which seemed to be a symbol for a festival was repeated and a project team was formed with people from Execution Committee of Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa and Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Administration Office, and key figures.
sen.cmt: 京都学生祭典事務局→Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Administration Office と英訳しました。
sen.e: Since the concept of the the 3rd Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa was 'From Event To Festival', the idea of introducing a dance to symbolize the festival was discussed and a project team was formed with people from thge Execution Committee of Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa and Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Administration Office, and other key figures.

Since the concept of the third Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa was 'From Event To Festival', the idea of introducing a dance to symbolize the festival was discussed and a project team was formed with people from the Executive Committee of Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa and Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Administration Office, and other key figures.
sen.cmt: 序数スペルアウトthe the→thethge→theExecution→Executive

sen.j: 踊りの振り付けについてはトモコダンスプラネットを主宰する今中友子が、踊りの音楽や衣装については株式会社太鼓センターが中心となって制作し、完成した踊りには第2回京都学生祭典の企画名の一つであった「京宴（きょうえん）」と仮称ながら名称が付けられた。
sen.e: Choreographing the dancers was mainly commissioned to Tomoko IMANAKA as an organizer of Tomoko Dance Planet, and dance music and costumes were produced mainly by Taiko Center Co., Ltd., and the original created dance was given a tentative name 'Kyoen (feast in Kyoto)', naming after the title of a certain program included in the 2nd Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.

Choreography was assigned to Tomoko IMANAKA, head of Tomoko Dance Planet, with music and costumes being produced mainly by Taiko Center Co., Ltd., and the completed dance was tentatively named 'Kyoen (feast in Kyoto)', after the title of an event included in the 2nd Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.

Choreography was assigned to Tomoko IMANAKA, head of Tomoko Dance Planet, with music and costumes being produced mainly by Taiko Center Co., Ltd., and the completed dance was tentatively named 'Kyoen (feast in Kyoto)', after the title of an event included in the second Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.

sen.j: 2005年3月21日の京都・東山花灯路にて、知恩院・三門を舞台にして「京宴」の初披露が行われた。
sen.e: On March 21, 2005, 'Kyoen' was first performed at Chionin Sanmon for a stage in Kyoto Higashiyama Hanatori.
On March 21, 2005, 'Kyoen' was first performed at Chion-in Temple's Sanmon Gate during the Kyoto Higashiyama Hanatori lantern festival.
On March 21, 2005, 'Kyoen' was first performed at Chion-in Temple's Sanmon Gate during the Kyoto Higashiyama Hanatoro lantern festival.
sen.cmt: at の後のスペース短縮Hanatori→Hanatoro

sen.j: また、同時に踊りの普及チームが発足し、京都地域を中心とする大学やイベントでのおどり披露活動、おどり手を希望する学生や市民へのおどり練習活動、小学校や中学校、地元自治体などへ披露と練習会をセットで行うおどり出前活動などを行うことになった。
sen.e: In addition, a team was formed to widespread the dance, and was involved in many activities such as performing dance at universities and events mainly in Kyoto, giving a dance practice to students and citizens, visit to elementary and middle schools and public sectors to demonstrate their dance and give practice as a set menu.

At the same time, a team was formed to popularize the dance, performing the dance at universities and events mainly in Kyoto, teaching students and citizens who were interested in the dance, and visiting elementary and middle schools and local authorities to demonstrate the dance and give lessons.

At the same time, a team was formed to popularize the dance, performing the dance at universities and events mainly in Kyoto, teaching students and citizens who were interested in the dance, and visiting elementary and middle schools and local authorities to demonstrate the dance and give lessons.

sen.j: 2005年5月には創作オリジナル踊りの名称を決める会議が、実行委員会と事務局、有識者などを集めて数回開催され、正式に「京炎 そでふれ！」と決まった。
sen.e: In May 2005, Execution Committee of Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Administration Office and key figures held several meetings to talk about the name of the original dance, and the official name was decided to be 'Kyoen Sodefure!.'

In May 2005, the Execution Committee of Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Administration Office and key figures held several meetings to talk about the name of the original dance, finally deciding on 'Kyoen Sodefure!' as the official name.

In May 2005, the Executive Committee of Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa Administration Office and key figures held several meetings to talk about the name of the original dance, finally deciding on 'Kyoen Sodefure!' as the official name.

sen.j: 第1回京都学生祭典実行委員会の実行委員に当時立命館大学産業社会学部に在籍していた倉木麻衣が所属していた。
sen.e: In the year of the 1st Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, Mai KURAKI was a student of the Industrial Sociology Department of Ritsumeikan Asia Pacific University and worked as an execution member of the Execution Committee of the 1st Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.

For the 1st Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, the singer Mai KURAKI, who was a student of the Industrial Sociology Department at Ritsumeikan Asia Pacific University, worked as an executive member of the Executive Committee.

For the first Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa, the singer Mai KURAKI, who was a student of the Industrial Sociology Department at Ritsumeikan University, worked as an executive member of the Executive Committee.
sen.cmt: 序数スペルアウト立命館大学の英訳が違うので訂正しました。

sen.j: そして、第1回京都学生祭典のGrand Finale企画において、平安神宮にてライブが実施された。
sen.e: Her live concert was held in Heian Jingu Shrine for the Grand Finale program in the 1st Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.
Her live concert, held in Heian Jingu Shrine, was the Grand Finale of the 1st Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.
Her live concert, held in Heian Jingu Shrine, was the Grand Finale of the first Kyoto Intercollegiate Festa.

sen.j: この様子に限り、後日日本放送協会でも近畿地方に限り放送された。
sen.e: Only this live concert was broadcast in the Kinki region by Japan Broadcasting Corporation.
The concert was later broadcast in the Kinki region by NHK.
sen.cmt: Revised to make less wordy- although Japan Broadcasting Corporation is the official English name, I think NHK is better known.
sen.e: The concert was later broadcast in the Kinki region by NHK.
